required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Valemetostat Tosylate (DS-3201b) Phase 2 Study in Relapsed or Refractory Adult T-cell Leukemia/Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Open-label, Single-arm Study of Valemetostat Tosylate (DS-3201b) in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Adult T-cell Leukemia/Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This Phase 2 study will be conducted to assess the efficacy and safety of valemetostat tosylate (DS-3201b) in participants with relapsed or refractory adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma (r/r ATL).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate (ORR) assessed by central evaluation organization
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were assessed for best overall response, who achieved complete remission (CR), complete remission, unconfirmed (CRu) or partial remission (PR) by central evaluation organization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate (ORR) assessed by investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were assessed for best overall response, who achieved CR, CRu, or PR by investigator.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Best response in target lesions (nodal or extranodal lesions), peripheral blood lesions, and skin lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were assessed for best overall response, who achieved CR or CRu.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who were assessed for best overall response, who achieved CR, CRu, PR or stable disease (SD).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Period from the first day of DS-3201b dose to the first day of CR, CRu, or PR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Period from first CR, CRu, or PR to residual disease/progressive disease (RD/PD) or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Period from the first day of DS-3201b dose to the day of RD/PD or death.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of the study (within approximately 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Period from the first day of DS-3201b dose to death.

intervention.description: Once a day, 200 mg, oral administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with relapsed or refractory adult T-cell leukemia/lymphoma (ATL) who have history of treatment with mogamulizumab or are mogamulizumab intolerant, contraindication after treatment with at least 1 medication regimen
- Aged ≥20 years or older at the time of signing the informed consent
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status (PS) of 0-2
- At least 1 evaluable lesion
- Participants who have defined laboratory criteria
- Life expectancy ≥ 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- A presence of central nervous system involvement at the time of screening tests
- Have poorly controlled complication (eg. chronic congestive heart failure, unstable angina
- ≥ Grade 3 neuropathy
- QT interval corrected using Fridericia's method (QTcF) >470 ms
- Has an uncontrolled infection
- Participants who use corticosteroids over 10 mg/day
- Receipt of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
- History of, or concurrent, malignant tumors

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://vivli.org/. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://vivli.org/ourmember/daiichi-sankyo/
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Studies for which the medicine and indication have received European Union (EU) and United States (US), and/or Japan (JP) marketing approval on or after 01 January 2014 or by the US or EU or JP Health Authorities when regulatory submissions in all regions are not planned and after the primary study results have been accepted for publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Formal request from qualified scientific and medical researchers on IPD and clinical study documents from clinical trials supporting products submitted and licensed in the United States, the European Union and/or Japan from 01 January 2014 and beyond for the purpose of conducting legitimate research. This must be consistent with the principle of safeguarding study participants' privacy and consistent with provision of informed consent.
